definition: to carve/carved words/to agree/a contract/a deed

sentences.english: With the chance of Universiade, Shenzhen proposes to build a voluntary city with the effort of all citizens.
sentences.chinese: 借大運會契機，深圳提出全民共建“志願之城”。

sentences.english: The new course reform has brought the new opportunity for the chemical teaching of highschool in the new period.
sentences.chinese: 新課程改革爲新時期的高中化學教學帶來了新的契機。

sentences.english: It makes a new chance for the inter-area damping control of the system.
sentences.chinese: 這就爲電力系統的區間阻尼控制提供了新的契機。

sentences.english: When the story is all about you, you limit your company's growth options.
sentences.chinese: 當這個故事全部都是你時，你將約束企業的成長契機。

sentences.english: Among these penumbras, I see the power and the turning point to change.
sentences.chinese: 如今這些陰影，讓我看見力量與改變的契機。

sentences.english: Our lives are the opportunity to find exact situations where we can fulfill our unique callings.
sentences.chinese: 我們要把握人生的契機去尋找我們存在的價值。

sentences.english: Braille opened up a new world of possibility and education.
sentences.chinese: 盲文開創了教育契機的新世界。

sentences.english: How can small businesses take advantage of the credit crunch?
sentences.chinese: 中小企業如何利用信貸危機所帶來的契機？

sentences.english: YHTCM, with the opportunity of developing the scenery belt along the Dongting Lake.
sentences.chinese: 以啓動沿湖風光帶岳陽樓核心景區建設爲發展契機。

sentences.english: The development of the Tea-drink has provided Beverage Ludustry with a new avene and effectiveness.
sentences.chinese: 茶飲料的蓬勃發展給飲料市場帶來了新的契機和活力。

sentences.english: All of the above bring a turning point to resurvey the value and connotation of Tang-Fu.
sentences.chinese: 凡此均提供重新審視唐賦價值與內涵的契機。

sentences.english: That is an opportunity that is worth effort.
sentences.chinese: 這是一個值得努力把握的契機。

sentences.english: The advent of the Age of Information brings about bright prospects to TEFL.
sentences.chinese: 信息時代的到來爲英語教學的發展帶來新的契機。

sentences.english: Fate has turned our little misadventure into a great opportunity.
sentences.chinese: 命運把我們的小失誤變成了一個偉大的契機。

sentences.english: With the department of science , art has new job-program modes.
sentences.chinese: 科技的進步爲藝術的發展帶來新的契機。

sentences.english: Europe should seize this crisis as an opportunity to transform the entire region.
sentences.chinese: 歐洲應該將此次危機視爲改革整個地區的契機。

definition: to push (for acceptance of a plan)/to push forward/to promote/to actuate/CL:個|个[ge4]
to break new ground (for agriculture)/to open up (a new seam)/to develop (border regions)/fig. to open up (new horizons)
to crane one's neck/to await eagerly/to lead/to show the way
to impel/to carry forward/to push on/to advance/to drive forward
to create/to bring about/to produce/to set (a record)
to achieve/to implement/to realize/to bring about
